column4: hey, what are some good music players on ubuntu? is there one similar to foobar?
vm settings like add or remove hardware, or even open the vm settings menu
have you tried defragmenting the vm
its a fresh machine pre-allocated on a totally blank partition
also i find XFS better for huge files and VMs.  i cant boot my vista mv off ext3 without serious lag every time.  but xfs works reasonably well for instance.  and xfs has a defrag tool xfs_fsr
im afraid i have no idea then
what is making it slow?  i/o?  cpu cycles?
how would i figure that out? im very new at this
using the gnome system monitor, gnome-system-monitor from terminal.  i have to go now unfortunately, may be able to help you.  but that can help track down wheree the lag is coming from
may be able to help you, later i mean.
do you end up at a "busybox"?
from the alternate or regular cds? from the alternate i end up at "ubuntu installer main menu" with the 3rd step "detect and mount cdrom" highlighted
i dont recall busybox from the other install media but i really dont remember
hmm.  does it say "tty job control" or anything weird like that?
yes it does, i can pop in the live cd right now to get the exact error message but that rings a bell
